net.jxta.content
Interface ContentTransfer

All Known Subinterfaces:
ContentTransferAggregator
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractContentTransfer, DefaultContentTransfer, NullContentTransfer, SRDISocketContentTransfer, TransferAggregator
public interface ContentTransfer

ContentTransfer objects represent the client / requesting side of a Content transfer mechanism. ContentTransfer instances are obtained through the use of a ContentProvider's retrieveContent method. This interface defines the bare minimum functionality to work with the client end of shared Content, although it was designed to be extended by ContentProvider implementations such that more detailed information and control over the transfer can be achieved.

This object may represent an intermediate layer between the application and one or more content provider implementations. This scenario occurs when ContentService implementations create a wrapping layer around multiple provider-specific ContentTransfer object instances. In this instance, the ContentTransferAggregator sub-interface should be used by the ContentProvider creating the transfer object instance to allow the end-user to maintain visibility through to the actual ContentTransfer instances being utilized.

An explicit effort was made to ensure that ContentTransfer instances would always be directly accessible to the end-user. This maintains the end-user's ability to use operations such as instanceof to identify a specific provider programatically, allowing a typecast or bean introspection to provde them with in-depth tuning controls, etc..

To enable failover, no access to the actual retrieved data should be provided/accessible until the entire Content has been retrieved.

See Also:
ContentShare, ContentTransferAggregator, ContentProvider, ContentService

Method Detail

addContentTransferListener

void addContentTransferListener(ContentTransferListener listener)
Adds an event listener to track the operation and progress of the transfer.

Parameters:
listener - listener instance to add

removeContentTransferListener

void removeContentTransferListener(ContentTransferListener listener)
Removes a previously registered event listener.

Parameters:
listener - listener instance to remove

getContentProvider

ContentProvider getContentProvider()
Get the provider which created and manages this transfer.

Returns:
ContentProvider instance which originated this transfer object instance

startSourceLocation

void startSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to begin the process of locating remote data sources. This process is allowed to take place independently of the transfer itself and can be used to help select a specific transfer implementation to use when used in a transfer aggregation. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation this method is treated as an advisory and is not required to be called prior to calling startTransfer.

stopSourceLocation

void stopSourceLocation()
Recommend or prompt the implementation to cease the process of locating remote data sources. As the source location process implementation is entirely dependent on the transfer implementation and as the cost of source location may vary widely from provider to provider, this method is treated as advisory and is not required to be called prior to or after calling startTransfer.

getSourceLocationState

ContentSourceLocationState getSourceLocationState()
Returns the current state of this transfer's remote source location activities.

Returns:
current source location state

startTransfer

void startTransfer(File destination)
Begins the process of finding and retrieving the Content, storing the results into the File location specified on as as-needed basis, overwriting any pre-existing data at this location. The state of the contents of the file path provided are to be considered by the end-user to be undefined until the completion of the transfer. At transfer completion, the file should only exist if the transfer was successful and only if the ContentProvided needed to use the file location to store data. Some transfer implementations may opt to not use the file location provided, in which case the ContentProvider should ensure that the file is deleted.

Parameters:
destination - file location to write the resulting data into

getTransferState

ContentTransferState getTransferState()
Returns the current data transfer state.

Returns:
current transfer state

cancel

void cancel()
Cancels all remote data source location and Content transfer activity, if still in progress. After a transfer has been cancelled it can no longer be used to locate sources or retrieve data. If a transfer has reached a terminal state (i.e., transferState.isFinished() returns true) then this method should have no effect.

waitFor

void waitFor()
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TransferException
Wait for the completion of the transfer.

Throws:
InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted.
TransferException - if there is an unrecoverable problem during the transfer
TransferCancelledException - if the cancel method is called or if the ContentProvider is shut down prior to transfer completion

waitFor

void waitFor(long timeout)
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TransferException
Wait for the completion of the transfer for a maximum of timeout milliseconds. If the timeout expires, the method will return without raising an exception.

Parameters:
timeout - maximum amount of time to wait, in milliseconds
Throws:
InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted.
TransferException - if there is an unrecoverable problem during the transfer
TransferCancelledException - if the cancel method is called or if the ContentProvider is shut down prior to transfer completion

getContent

Content getContent()
                   throws InterruptedException,
                          TransferException
Blocks until the Content transfer has completed (or failed) and then returns the completed Content.

Throws:
InterruptedException - when the thread is interrupted.
TransferException - if there is an unrecoverable problem during the transfer
TransferCancelledException - if the cancel method is called or if the ContentProvider is shut down prior to transfer completion
